comments.body:
why `keyValue @ _` instead of just `keyValue`? I know it's been here before this particular change, but just curious why it is here.

`keyValue` is not even being used, so `_` should be sufficient. Boy Scout Rule applies, you touched it, so: `Always leave the campground cleaner than you found it` :)

`keyValue @ _` is a notation to avoid singleton variable warning. 
Sometime having name for variable in pattern matching, make the later more readable.
It does not really improve readability in this case, so I apply the change you requested.
I'd rather have this called explicitly. What's the advantage of having this as an implicit conversion? The explicit call looks very brief and understandable.
Whatâ€™s up with all those changes?
fixed
...transaction structure

comments.body:
~why do we need an `Engine` here if we don't use it?~
scratch it... it overrides the one from the outer context.

```suggestion
    ContractIdString.assertFromString(s)
```

As a consequence of the proposed aliases for `LedgerString`, and similarly for other direct references to `LedgerString` in order to call methods.
mostly done. I have some more cleanup to do. I will fix the remaining ones (EventId, WorkflowId, ApplicationId ...)  in an upcoming PR.
